image.altText: A low grass fire burns across a hillside as heavy smoke blankets the landscape during bushfire conditions in Longwood, Victoria.

props.synopsis: On Sunday afternoon, emergency services discovered the body of a person in Central Victoria. The fatal turn comes as firefighters use favourable conditions to contain more than 20 blazes across the state.

title.children: Victoria's bushfire crisis turns deadly as conditions ease

image.altText: people hug and embrace at a community barbecue

props.synopsis: In a region famed for its lush pastoral farmland, locals thought Harcourt was less likely to be hit than neighbouring bush towns Castlemaine and Barkers Creek.

title.children: 'This was a safe place': Harcourt's heart in ruins but community stands strong

image.altText: A close up photo of a white car with the word "police" written in blue over the bonnet and blue and white checks on the side.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating reports of an Islamic community leader being assaulted after he and his wife were forced off the road by a vehicle and racially abused in Dandenong South.

title.children: Muslim leader and wife allegedly abused, assaulted in Melbourne

image.altText: A graphic of a female athlete throwing a javelin with a dollar sign on it

props.synopsis: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

title.children: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths

image.altText: A photo taken from a paddock of hills in the distance with multiple areas alight with orange fire at dusk.

props.synopsis: Victoria confirms its first fatality in the bushfire emergency ravaging the state, with police discovering human remains east of the town of Seymour.

title.children: Human remains discovered near car in bushfire-ravaged area

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese shakes the hand of a fire warnings official inside the Bendigo Incident Control Centre.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Jacinta Allan announce a multi-million-dollar emergency relief package for those affected by Victoria's devastating bushfires, as authorities warn hundreds of structures have been lost.

title.children: PM unveils $20m support fund as crews take stock of fire devastation

image.altText: Bradley and Christina Irvine surveying the damage around their property.

props.synopsis: Everywhere you look around the Irvines' farm near Alexandra are signs of the fire that surrounded their home and burnt right up to the front porch.

title.children: Property saved with mops, mates and rakes after fire encircles home

image.altText: A close up of a man with a CFA uniform on.

props.synopsis: CFA volunteer Michael Harper discovers through the truck radio while on shift that his home is under threat.

title.children: 'Mate, let's go again': Firefighter continues shift after home burns

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese shakes the hand of a fire warnings official inside the Bendigo Incident Control Centre.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Jacinta Allan announce a multi-million-dollar emergency relief package for those affected by Victoria's devastating bushfires, as authorities warn hundreds of structures have been lost.

title.children: PM unveils $20m support fund as crews take stock of fire devastation

image.altText: A man and a woman survey a burnt out home.

props.synopsis: Several fires have been downgraded to watch and act but authorities are still battling to control many of the blazes that have claimed one life and destroyed hundreds of structures.

title.children: Two blazes left at emergency level in Victoria after 390,000 hectares burnt — as it happened

image.altText: A woman looks distressed

props.synopsis: Harcourt residents describe their devastation and gratitude in the wake of a massive blaze that swept through the town.

title.children: Harcourt community reeling after fire levels homes and businesses

image.altText: A building razed by bushfire is surrounded by blackened grass and trees.

props.synopsis: During winter the trees and hills surrounding the small hamlet of Ruffy are beautiful and green, but now it has been "decimated" by an out-of-control bushfire.

title.children: Victorians describe coming face-to-face with life-threatening fire danger

image.altText: Smoke-filled clouds cover the skyline and hover over a house in Jindabyne in New South Wales.

props.synopsis: The heatwave, which has engulfed southern Australia this week, has become one of the most intense on record.

title.children: Weekend brings fire threat to NSW, with maximums to hit 44C

image.altText: Silhouette of transmission lines at dusk with sun flaring through

props.synopsis: For so long, the pounding sunshine of an Australian heatwave was the grid's biggest threat. It has now become its greatest asset.

title.children: From scourge to saviour: How the sun powered the grid through a heatwave

image.altText: A standing fan in a bedroom

props.synopsis: The study by Griffith University in Brisbane finds that a room temperature while sleeping of more than 24 degrees Celsius increases heart rate variability and physiological stress.

title.children: Study finds link between room temperature and sleep stress for elderly

image.altText: Christine Pulis pictured on her rural property.

props.synopsis: Catastrophic fire danger warnings are in place across parts of Victoria's north and west today, with two significant fires already burning out of control and soaring temperatures forecast on Friday.

title.children: 'It's my home': Victorians evacuate as fires intensify

image.altText: A lady holding an aircon remote control and pointing it towards the unit system on the wall

props.synopsis: With the nation gripped by a heatwave, renters will be looking at their rights for cooling their homes. Here's what they can do.

title.children: What landlords are obliged to do to cool your rental property

image.altText: Outdoor gym, people exercising Sydney.

props.synopsis: Despite parts of Australia experiencing the worst heatwave conditions since the 2019-20 Black Summer, people can still be spotted braving the hot weather to go for a run. Should they be doing this?

title.children: Is it safe to exercise outside during hot weather amid heatwave?

image.altText: A composite image of two smiling boys, one in a black basketball top with a medal around his neck and the other in a white top.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives lay further murder charges over the high-profile deaths of 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer suburbs last September.

title.children: Police lay further charges over Melbourne boys' stabbing deaths

image.altText: Fire damage at a home near Longwood.

props.synopsis: Three people, including a child, are missing after a house was destroyed by the out-of-control Longwood bushfire in central Victoria, according to police.

title.children: Three people missing in Longwood bushfire

image.altText: A map of Australia over a blue background, showing a line graph trending up and down.

props.synopsis: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves through the southern states.

title.children: Track temperatures live as southern states bake in heatwave

image.altText: People enjoying the hot weather at Bondi Beach.

props.synopsis: Southern states continue to sweat through one of the most intense heatwaves on record, and for many regions, including Melbourne and Sydney, the hottest weather is still to come.

title.children: Weather system brews 'perfect storm' for abnormally intense heatwave

image.altText: A map of Australia over a scorched outback, showing a line graph trending up into the red.

props.synopsis: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves through the southern states.

title.children: Track the heatwave as temperatures soar

image.altText: teenagers jumping off a bridge into the water

props.synopsis: A breeze will bring a brief reprieve for coastal areas of Victoria and South Australia today before the heat and fire danger ramps up again tomorrow.

title.children: State-by-state breakdown of the heatwave as a 47C day looms for some

image.altText: Farmers work to pick their spinach crop at Dicky Bill Farm in Gippsland.

props.synopsis: About 160 staff lost their jobs when Dicky Bill collapsed owing up to $10 million. Two separate businesses have stepped in to take over, but not all operations will reopen.

title.children: Workers rehired as new managers revive Dicky Bill salad farms

image.altText: Carriages from a derailed freight train.

props.synopsis: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

title.children: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know

image.altText: A wind turbine silhouetted against a clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Kentbruck Green Energy Hub would include wind turbines up to 270m tall, and be built inside active pine plantations, but its location has worried conservationists.

title.children: Planned wind farm next to Ramsar-listed wetlands passes 'significant' hurdle

image.altText: A girl sits on the floor hunched in a corner next to a cupboard, peering over her knees.

props.synopsis: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

title.children: Care workers say they are powerless to stop children using ice

image.altText: A view of dead trees at sunset.

props.synopsis: From Tasmania to the Top End, Australia's forest trees are dying at higher rates due to climate change, according to new research.

title.children: As the world warms, more trees are dying in Australian forests

image.altText: A still image from CCTV vision of seven boys dressed in jumpers and long pants walking along a footpath beside a waterway.

props.synopsis: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

title.children: Machete ambush after teenagers lured to park in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Man with hand raised with political advertising behind him

props.synopsis: The outgoing MP will vacate the deputy leadership role in February, clearing the way for a refreshed leadership team to carry the opposition to this year's election.

title.children: Sam Groth to relinquish deputy Liberal leadership next month

image.altText: A woman sits on a bed. The bedspread is covered in images of her son.

props.synopsis: Ben Austin died in late October after a being struck by a cricket ball. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no-one is to blame for the tragic accident.

title.children: 'Knew straight away': Ben Austin's parents reflect on the cricket tragedy that shattered their family

image.altText: A vehicle with a Happy Chanukah! sign that has sustained fire damage.

props.synopsis: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne

image.altText: drawing of a young girl using the phone in bed at night, next to an image of a man on a laptop in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

title.children: Teenage girl sexually assaulted and pregnant while in state care

image.altText: Birds eye view of a housing estate with an oval and park towards the bottom of the image

props.synopsis: Thousands of young trees dot the streets and front gardens of this outer Melbourne suburb as part of a neighbourhood-wide push to create more shade and curb the urban heat island effect.

title.children: Tree by tree, this new suburb is dodging baking heat in summer
